data.title: How to watch One Piece in order? All episodes and movies
data.meta_description: We tell you in what order you can watch the entire One Piece anime, including the filler, so you can choose how to follow each saga and story arc.
data.text:
One Piece is one of the most iconic manga and anime of all time. Eiichiro Oda’s work has sold more copies than any other work in the manga universe, including Dragon Ball, and its transcendence has attracted tens of millions of fans around the world. With more than 1000 episodes adapted by Toei Animation since 1999; added to its numerous movies, it is easy to consider that the anime can be complicated to watch. In this article, we will tell you in what order to watch the entire anime series.

The first thing we need to make clear is that the One Piece anime follows the chronological order of the manga. There are no major changes, and it is easy to see which arcs are canon (based on the manga) and which are filler arcs (original to the anime; not canon, you can delve deeper on the differences here). While Naruto had episodes that were part canon and part filler, One Piece does not. This is the right place if you want to watch the whole anime and skip all the filler.

If you’re new to One Piece or want to attempt the monumental task of rewatching everything the series has to offer, then you’ll want to know the proper order in which to do so. As you will see below, we divide the structure of the series into two big blocks: before the time jump and after the time jump, similar to Dragon Ball and Dragon Ball Z or Naruto and Naruto Shippuden. And don’t worry, we won’t go into any kind of spoilers.

East Blue Saga (episodes 1-61)

Arabasta Saga (episodes 62-135)

Sky Island Saga (episodes 136-206)

Water 7 Saga (episodes 207-325)

Thriller Bark Saga (episodes 326-384)

Summit War Saga (episodes 385-516)

Time Skip to The Final Sea: The New World Saga

Fish-Man Island Saga (episodes 517-574)

Dressrosa Saga (episodes 575-746)

Four Emperors Saga (episodes 747- Ongoing)

All One Piece movies: order and when to watch them
